712553f.title: Manhattan: 39th Street (East) - Park Avenue
712553f.text:
30, 28, 26 East 39th Street, south side, between Park and Madison
Avenues. No. 28 is the Psi Upsilon Club of New York.
About 1920.
dift of E. M. Jenks.

722102f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 39th Street
722102f-a.text:
(1)
Park Avenue, east side, from 39th to 40th Streets, seen from 40th
Street across the lot left by demolition of buildings on the
S.W. corner of 40th Street. The house shown on he S.E.
corner of 40th Street is the Visiting Nurses' Club, and the
adjoining house the Navy Club. The rest of the buildings
in the block will be demolished in 1933.
December 3, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, but seen across the Avenue from 39th Street, and
showing demolition of the olc bnownstone houses, leaving
only the two in the northern end of the block.
September 10, 1933.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

115, 117, 11V East 39th Street, north side, between Park and

722097f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 39th Street
722097f-a.text:
Park Avenue, north on west side, fromm 39th to 42nd Streets, showing
the Princeton Club at the N.W. corner of 39th Street and the three
buildings in the northern half of that block which are about to
be demolished. The Hotel Belmont, in the block from 41st to 42nd
Streets, above the Murray Hill Hotel, has just been demolished.
In the background are shown the Lefcourt Colonial Building at
Madison Avenue and 41st Street, and the Lincoln Building at 60
East 42nd Steet.
August 25, 1931.
P. L. SpeIYr, Photographer.
NO PEPRODUCTIONS.

712557f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street - Park Avenue
712557f-a.text:
3Vth Street, noth side, from Park to Fifth Avenues, showing the
tower of 9 East 39th Street or 10 East 40th. Street.
October 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722095f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 39th Street
722095f-a.text:
(1)
Fark Avenue, east side, from 39th to 40th Streets, seen from t)
tall building at 271 Madison Avenuc, showing the Nunses' Clut
at the N.E. corner of 40th Street and the Navy Club adjoining
it. The other houses in the block, beginning with the small
one in the middle, are to be demolished in 1933.
In the background may be seen some of the 42nd Street skyscrape
the twin buildings of Tudor City overlooking the East River,
the dim outlines of Long Island City on the other side.
December 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, at an earlier date.
October 12, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
N-~ 292G

722085f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 39th Street (East)
722085f-a.text:
Park Ave., north from East 39th Street, showing W.P.A. employees re-
constructing the former street car (before that,used by railroad) tunnel
for future vehicular use. Shown in the background is the automobile
ramp around Grand Central station that this will hook up to.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

722108f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 40th Street
722108f-a.text:
Rark Avenue, east side at 40th Street, seen from a considerable
height. On the N.E. corner stands the Architects' Building.
101 Park Avenue, built about 1916. Cn the S.E. co ne may be
seen the Nursos' Club, and next to it the National Navy Club.
The other buildings facing Park Avenue in that block, beginning
with the small 3-story house to the right of the Navy Club, will
be demolished in 1931.
The skyscraper in the right background is the Chanin Building.
December 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722108f-b.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 40th Street
722108f-b.text:
Rark Avenue, east side at 40th Street, seen from a considerable
height. On the N.E. corner stands the Architects' Building.
101 Park Avenue, built about 1916. Cn the S.E. co ne may be
seen the Nursos' Club, and next to it the National Navy Club.
The other buildings facing Park Avenue in that block, beginning
with the small 3-story house to the right of the Navy Club, will
be demolished in 1931.
The skyscraper in the right background is the Chanin Building.
December 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722094f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 39th Street (East)
722094f-a.text:
(1)
Park Ave., east side, north from East 39th to 40th Streets. Show:
at the N.E. corner is a country home, erected for demonstration purposes.
Buildings standing at the S.E. corner of 40th Street, are Nos. 93-99 in-
clusive. No. 99-97 (at and adjoining the corner), is the Nurses Club;
Nos. 95-93, the Navy Club.
March 22, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCYIONS.
(2)
A closer view of ''America's Little House'.
March 22, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
This entire block front has been purchased by the City as a new site
of t1e Appellate Division of the Supreme Court. On completion of same
they will move from their present quarters at the N.E. corner of Madison
Ave. and East 25th Street. The Henry Street Visiting Nurse Service
have purchased the former Wm. Goadhhy Loew residence at the S.W. corner
of Madison Ave. and East 39th Street and will shortly move their
executive offices there after remodelling.strdctcrecto meet their needs.
For a fuller account see the New York Sun of February 15, 1936 and March
29, 1938 and the New York Times of March 25, 1938.

722104f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 40th Street
722104f-a.text:
Park Avenue, weat side, at 40th Street, showing the old Murray Hill
Hotel, from 40th to 41st Streets, and the houses on the S.W. corner
of 40th Street which will be demolished in 1931.
February 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722091f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 39th Street
722091f-a.text:
Park Avenue at S.W. corner of 39th Street, showing old mansion
and two houses acjacent on Park Avenue which will be demolished
in 1933. The top of the Allerton House Fraternity Clubs
building at Madison Avenue and 38th Street is iust visible
over the roof of the corner house.
May 31, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, five years later, showing demolition nearly complete.
The large blank wall shown in the center of the picture is
that of the first house on the south side of 39th Street.
In the background rise the towers of the Allerton House
Fraternity Clubs, on the S.E. corner of 38th Street, the
International Combustion Building at 200 Madison Avenue, and,
between them, the Empire State Builoing.
September 9, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712550f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street (East) - Park Avenue
712550f-a.text:
East 39th Street, west from Park Avenue. At the left
and right respectively are an open lot and the Princeton
Club. At Madison Avenue is another clearance. View 2
is closer to same. This emphasizes the reconstructed
former residence housing the administrative staff of the
Henry Street Nursing Service. It stands at the S.E. cor-
ner of Madison Avenue. Mrs. Goadby Loew, the daughter
of George F. Baker, resided here.
April 11, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPEODUCTIONS

722114f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 40th Street
722114f-a.text:
(1)
Park Avenue, west side, from 40th to 42nd Streets, including
two buildings on the S.W. corner of 40th Street which will
be demolished in October 1931. The old Murray Hill Hotel
is shown in the block from 40th to 41st Streets and the
Hotel Belmont (1906-1931) in the block above it, as they
appeared before the Lincoln Building was erected alongside
the Belmont at 60 East 42nd Street.
At 4Oth Street may be seen a traffic signal tower of the type
in use from about 1925 to 1928.
February 6, 1928.
P. L. Sper, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, but a closer view not showing the S.W. corner of 40th
Street, taken after the erection of the Lincoln Building and
before the demolition of the Hotel Belmont (1906-31).
December 13, 1930.
L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, showing the clearing on the S.W. corner of 40th Street,
and the view of the Hotel Biltmore, on Vanderbilt Avenue from
43rd to 44th Steets, mmade possible by the demolition of the
Hotel Belmont in the block north of the Murray Hill Hotel.
DDecember 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712620f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street - Park Avenue
712620f-a.text:
40th Street, south sioe, from Park to Madison Avenues. The corner
house, 78 Park Avenue, is being demolished.
Ootober 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722110f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 40th Street
722110f-a.text:
Park Avenue, west side, from 40th to 41st Streets, showing the
old Murray Hill Botel, which dates back to the 1870's, against
a background of modern skyscrapers. To the right is the
Lincoln Building, completed late in 1929, at 60 East 42nd
Street, and to the left the Lefcourt Colonial Building (1929)
on the S.W. corner of Madison Avenue and 41st Street and the
Murray Hill Offices building (1926), which together take up
the entire east side of Madison Avenue from 41st to 40th
Streets. Behind the latter, to the left of the Lefcourt
tower, may be seen the top of 500 Fifth Avenue, completed on
the N.W. corner of 42nd Street in January 1931.
December 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.
(2)
The ssme, but showing a little of the cleaing at the S.W.
corner of 40th Street, and missing the tops of the Lincoln
and Lefcourt Colonial buildings.
In the block above the Muray Hill, from 4lst to 42nd Streets,
the Hotel Belmont has been den:olished. Through the gap thus
created may be seen the west side of Vanderbilt Avenue st
43rd Street; the Hotel Biltmore (erected about 1914) is the
building shown in part on the N.W. corner.
December 2, 1931
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712551f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street - Park Avenue
712551f-a.text:
30th Street, north side, west from but not including Park Avenue.
December 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712552f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street (East) - Park Avenue
712552f-a.text:
33 East 39th Street, north side, between Park and Madison Avenues,
at the time of its purchase by a family returning to Murray Hill.
1Vlu.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

722086f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 39th Street
722086f-a.text:
77 Park Avenue at the S.E. corner of 39th Street, a new apart-
ment house nearing completion. This entire block has been rebuilt
since 1921; the building partly shown on the right is the corner
house at 38th Street which replaced the old C. D. Barney house in
1922. Compare this picture with the N.E. corner of 38th Street in
early 1922 and notice also how the center parks have been modernized
to leave more room for motor traffic.
1924.
Joseph Smith.
MAY BE REPRODGCED.
Nea w (o7

722107f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 40th Street
722107f-a.text:
Park Avenue, east aide at 40th Street, showing the Nurses' Club
at the S.E. corner of 40th Street and the National Navy Club
next to it.
On the N.E. corner may be seen the Architects' Building, 101 Park
Avenue, built 19lo, and the smaller and rather older Terminal
Building, No. 103.
Notice the traffic signal torer characteristic of the mid 1920's.
October 12, 1927.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

722118f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Avenue - 40th Street
722118f-a.text:
Park Avenue, west side, from 41st to 40th Streets, showing the old
Murray Hill Hotel and pa t of the excavation, at the N.W. corner of
41st Street, left by demolition of the Hotel Belmont.
In the immediate foreground southbound automobiles on the Pershing
Square Viaduct are shown waiting for the green light.
October 21, 1931.
L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
